quest.name: A Stable's Condition
journal:
Seigetsu the Enlightened requires your assistance with some festival preparations.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the Namazu horse handler.

You have spoken with the Namazu horse handler.
Deliver the requested supplies to Seigetsu the Enlightened.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Forename, do you recall the horse racing tradition shared with us by the Mol? Well, we should like to continue with our own ceremonial races, but by my educated estimations, we are lacking certain supplies vital for the care of our horses.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Whilst my own knowledge in such areas is purely theoretical, I imagine that you, as a productive member of the civilized races, would find the practice of raising livestock a trivial affair, yes?

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: A fortunate thing indeed, for although I entrusted the gathering of said supplies to our appointed horse handler, I fear he has failed to return. I suspect he has encountered difficulties. Please look for him in the vicinity of Ceol Aen, and uncover the cause of this delay.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: <sigh> I'm putting together as many of the stable supplies as I'm able, but I've not enough fins to handle all these tasks.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind making some horseshoes for me? The crate just there should hold everything you need.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind making some grooming brushes for me? The crate just there should hold everything you need.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind making some bridle oil for me? The crate just there should hold everything you need.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind digging up some steppe iron for me? We need it for making horseshoes. The rocks to the south of Chakha Zoh should have a vein or two you can mine.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind gathering some fodder for the horses? The foliage to the south of Chakha Zoh should do nicely. It's so dry, they call it “steppe hay,” apparently.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Would you mind finding some salmon roe for bait, and fishing up a moon oyster from Tao Khaal? It can be made into an ointment for soothing saddle sores and the like. Or so Seigetsu told me. At great length.

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: Once you've prepared these absolutely essential supplies, please deliver them directly to Seigetsu. I'll see that my share of the goods is not far behind!

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: What's the matter? Have you misplaced your materials? There should be plenty more in my little crate. It's deceptively roomy!

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: There should be veins of steppe iron to the south of here. Keep an eye out!

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: There should be patches of steppe hay to the south of here. Keep an eye out!

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: There should be moon oysters in the waters of Tao Khaal. I hear with a little salmon roe, they jump right onto your hook!

dialogue.name: DAILYNAMAZUO03116
dialogue.text: You have the supplies I asked of you? Then please make your delivery directly to Seigetsu before he comes to “enlighten” us on the merits of haste!

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Ah, so you located our aspiring horse handler. ...Not flattened under a khun chuluu, was he?

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Not enough fins to finish his tasks!? Well he cannot rely on you to pick up the slack every time a job proves too overwhelming. We shall have to discuss the allocation of his duties upon his return. At length.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: If things progress in this manner, I wonder if we shall ever prove suitable masters for our stables. With our stunted limbs, Namazu struggle to cling to a horse's back as it is, and we certainly cannot direct the beasts to gallop where we wish.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: On that front, I have been perusing the anatomical journals of past and present, researching a method for the permanent elongation of fins and legs. My current goal is to evolve our species to stand some eight heads tall.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: On the dawn that such an evolution is realized, the name of Seigetsu the Enlightened will be burned forever into the pages of Namazu history. I shall be lauded as a hero of our civilization, and you, my friend, might even gain a mention in the footnotes!
